cards.name: Wingsuit Flying
cards.subtitle: Aerial gliding in a wingsuit, mimicking a flying squirrel with human wings.
cards.imageAttr: Richard Schneider from Los Angeles, CC BY 2.0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: BASE Jumping
cards.subtitle: Jumping from fixed objects such as cliffs or buildings with just one parachute.
cards.imageAttr: Chris McNaught from Twin Falls, Idaho, CC BY 2.0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: High-Altitude Military Parachuting (HALO)
cards.subtitle: High-altitude skydiving with low-opening parachutes for stealth and precision landings.
cards.imageAttr: USASOC News Service, CC BY 2.0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Paragliding
cards.subtitle: Foot-launched gliding sport, with acrobatic stunts in the sky.
cards.imageAttr: Vyacheslav Argenberg, CC BY 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Speed Flying
cards.subtitle: Fast-paced aerial descent using a small glider, close to mountainous terrain.
cards.imageAttr: Pastelitodepapa, CC0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: BASE Wingsuit Proximity Flying
cards.subtitle: High-speed gliding close to terrain after leaping from cliffs, blending wingsuit flying with BASE jumping.
cards.imageAttr: Richard Schneider from Los Angeles, CC BY 2.0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Heli-skiing
cards.subtitle: Off-trail skiing, where skiers are dropped by helicopter into remote and untouched powder snow.
cards.imageAttr: Bureau of Land Management, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Big Wave Surfing
cards.subtitle: Surfing giant waves over 20 feet, with some waves reaching 50+ feet, requiring extreme skill and courage.
cards.imageAttr: Julie Macey jules144, CC0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Tow-in Surfing
cards.subtitle: A method of catching massive waves with the help of a watercraft, invented to break the 30 ft barrier.
cards.imageAttr: Luis Ascenso from Lisbon, Portugal, CC BY 2.0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Cave Diving
cards.subtitle: Exploring water-filled caves with no direct access to the surface, requiring advanced diving skills and equipment.
cards.imageAttr: Marco Busdraghi, CC BY 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Freediving
cards.subtitle: A deep-diving competition where athletes descend to extreme depths on a single breath, without breathing apparatus.
cards.imageAttr: jayhem from Antibes, France, CC BY 2.0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Whitewater Kayaking
cards.subtitle: Navigating highly technical, dangerous rapids with powerful currents, large waves, and substantial drops.
cards.imageAttr: User:Duncanogi, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Jetboard
cards.subtitle: A motorized surfboard allowing riders to surf without needing waves, controlled by a handheld remote.
cards.imageAttr: Watersloth, CC BY-SA 4.0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Shark Diving (without a cage)
cards.subtitle: Free-diving with some of the oceanâ€™s top predators, including great white sharks, without the protection of a cage.
cards.imageAttr: National Marine Sanctuaries, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Extreme Cliff Diving
cards.subtitle: Plunging from heights of 30 meters or more into water, a daring mix of precision and thrill.
cards.imageAttr: prayitno from Los Angeles, USA, CC BY 2.0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Downhill Mountain Biking
cards.subtitle: Racing downhill on steep, rough terrain with jumps, rock gardens, and high-speed descents.
cards.imageAttr: Ingo Kappherr, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Freestyle Motocross (FMX)
cards.subtitle: A thrilling offshoot of motocross where riders perform aerial stunts, jumps, and flips.
cards.imageAttr: https://pixabay.com/ru/users/Mistery08-2680981/, CC0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Street Luge
cards.subtitle: A high-speed, gravity-powered sport where racers ride supine on boards down paved hills.
cards.imageAttr: The original uploader was Dave.ca at English Wikipedia., CC BY-SA 2.5, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Ultra-Trail Running (100+ km)
cards.subtitle: Long-distance endurance running on rugged terrain, often covering over 100 kilometers in mountainous regions.
cards.imageAttr: Sgt. Jacqueline Fennell, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Ski Mountaineering
cards.subtitle: A challenging alpine sport combining skiing and mountaineering, often involving both ascents and descents on skis.
cards.imageAttr: Nicolas Vigier, CC0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Ice Climbing
cards.subtitle: A winter sport involving scaling frozen waterfalls or ice-covered cliffs using specialized tools.
cards.imageAttr: Forest Service Northern Region, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Free Solo Climbing
cards.subtitle: Climbing without ropes or safety equipment, where any fall can be fatal.
cards.imageAttr: Fox Sports, CC BY 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Sandboarding
cards.subtitle: A thrilling boardsport similar to snowboarding, but on sand dunes, practiced worldwide in deserts and beaches.
cards.imageAttr: Steven J. Weber, Public domain, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Volcano Boarding
cards.subtitle: A thrilling adventure where riders descend active or dormant volcanoes, reaching speeds up to 87 km/h.
cards.imageAttr: NicaPlease, CC0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Ice Cross Downhill
cards.subtitle: A high-speed race on ice skates down a walled track with sharp turns and steep drops.
cards.imageAttr: Letartean, CC BY 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Snowkiting
cards.subtitle: A thrilling winter sport where athletes use kites to glide on snow or ice, even uphill.

cards.name: Parkour
cards.subtitle: A discipline focusing on efficient movement through urban and natural obstacles using running, jumping, and climbing techniques.
cards.imageAttr: Noel Demulier, CC0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Mountain Unicycling (MUni)
cards.subtitle: An adventurous off-road sport requiring balance, stamina, and agility to traverse challenging terrain on a single wheel.
cards.imageAttr: Lord van Tasm, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Canyoning
cards.subtitle: A thrilling adventure combining climbing, swimming, rappelling, and jumping to traverse canyons.
cards.imageAttr: Krish Dulal, CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons

cards.name: Highlining
cards.subtitle: Walking across a slackline set at extreme heights between cliffs, buildings, or other elevated points.
cards.imageAttr: Pit1233, CC0, via Wikimedia Commons
